world_news:
• [Nov 25, 3:39 AM] Ukraine Conflict: Russia launched a major missile and drone attack on Kyiv, the second of its kind this month, causing significant damage to infrastructure.
  • [Nov 25, 9:00 AM] Middle East Diplomacy: Ceasefire negotiations between Israel and Hamas have reportedly stalled, with mediators calling for both sides to show more flexibility to avoid further escalation of the conflict.
  • [Nov 25, 11:00 AM] Global Economy: The European Central Bank has hinted at potential interest rate cuts in the first quarter of 2026, citing slowing inflation and economic stagnation in the Eurozone.
  • [Nov 25, 8:30 AM] AI Regulation: World leaders are gathered for the second day of the global AI Safety Summit, focusing on the creation of an international regulatory body for artificial intelligence.
  • [Nov 24, 8:00 PM] Automotive Industry: Two major legacy automakers have announced a surprise merger, aiming to pool resources for research and development of electric and autonomous vehicles to better compete in the market.
  • [Nov 25, 1:00 AM] China's Economy: China's latest economic data shows a significant slowdown in growth for the fourth quarter, sparking concerns about the potential impact on global supply chains and financial markets.
  • [Nov 25, 12:00 PM] European Climate Protests: Large-scale protests have broken out in several major European cities, including Berlin and Paris, in response to new government policies aimed at accelerating the green transition.
  • [Nov 24, 5:00 PM] Amazon Deforestation: The Brazilian government has unveiled a new set of aggressive policies to combat illegal deforestation in the Amazon rainforest, including increased satellite monitoring and law enforcement presence.
  • [Nov 25, 10:30 AM] Sudan Peace Talks: Peace negotiations aimed at resolving the ongoing conflict in Sudan have resumed in Addis Ababa, with international mediators expressing cautious optimism for a breakthrough.
  • [Nov 25, 7:00 AM] Global Health: The World Health Organization has issued a warning about a new strain of avian flu that has shown limited human-to-human transmission, urging nations to update their pandemic preparedness plans.
tech_news:
• [Nov 25, 2025, 12:11 PM] Microsoft's AI chatbot Copilot to exit WhatsApp: Microsoft announced that its AI assistant, Copilot, will no longer be available on WhatsApp starting January 15, 2026, due to new platform policies by the messaging service that restrict general-purpose AI chatbots.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 11:14 AM] Fleet Space discovers massive lithium deposit: Using a combination of AI and satellite technology, Australian company Fleet Space has identified a significant lithium deposit in Quebec, Canada, a discovery that could have major implications for the battery and EV industries.
  • [Nov 25, 2025, 10:15 AM] Spotify to increase US prices: A new report indicates that Spotify is planning to raise the prices of its subscription plans in the United States in the first quarter of 2026 to boost revenue, following pressure from record labels.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 5:27 PM] OpenAI's 'cameo' feature in Sora app faces trademark issue: OpenAI may need to rename a feature in its Sora video generation app after it was revealed that the word 'cameo' is trademarked by the popular celebrity video message platform Cameo.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 4:10 PM] EU regulator disputes Tesla's FSD approval claim: A Dutch regulator has contradicted Tesla's assertion that its Full Self-Driving (FSD) software is on the verge of approval in the European Union, stating that no such approval has been granted.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 9:03 AM] Malaysia considers social media ban for under-16s: The Malaysian government is contemplating a ban on social media access for individuals under the age of 16, with the new regulations potentially taking effect as early as next year. The country's communications minister cited the need to protect young users from the negative impacts of social media.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 7:30 AM] Rocket Lab CEO discusses Neutron delays: In an interview, Rocket Lab's CEO, Peter Beck, addressed the delays in the development of the company's larger Neutron rocket, while also commenting on the success of Blue Origin's New Glenn and the importance of NASA's role in space exploration.

conspiracies:
• [Nov 20, 2025, 9:50 PM] Theory: Governor Maura Healey of Massachusetts reignited the long-standing debate over vaccine safety by publicly denouncing RFK Jr.'s stance, stating, 'The evidence is clear: vaccines do not cause autism. Vaccines save lives. Undermining Americans’ trust in them is dangerous.' This has led to a resurgence of online theories alleging a conspiracy to suppress information about vaccine side effects.
  • [Nov 20, 2025, 1:37 PM] Theory: A high-level political conspiracy in Nigeria is being alleged by Omoyele Sowore, who claims the verdict in Mazi Nnamdi Kanu’s case was predetermined by the Bola Ahmed Tinubu regime. Sowore asserts that a plan was devised to sentence Kanu to death or life imprisonment, with the judicial process being a mere formality to legitimize a politically motivated decision.
  • [Nov 19, 2025, 5:17 PM] Theory: An employee of a federal official has been charged with conspiracy to falsely report a violent attack. This has led to online speculation about the motives behind the false report, with some theories suggesting it was an attempt to frame political opponents or to cover up other illicit activities.
  • [Nov 19, 2025, 4:19 PM] Theory: The arrest of Archbishop Angel Oyeghe in Nigeria for conspiracy and naira mutilation has sparked theories that the arrest is politically motivated. Online discussions suggest that the Archbishop was targeted due to her influence and that the charges are a pretext to silence a prominent critic of the government.
  • [Nov 18, 2025, 12:22 PM] Theory: A man in Lagos, Nigeria, was sentenced to 50 years in prison for a £15,000 fraud scheme. The case has drawn attention to the use of celebrity impersonations in online scams, with theories circulating that this is just the tip of the iceberg of a much larger, organized criminal conspiracy targeting unsuspecting fans.
  • [Nov 12, 2025, 8:24 PM] Theory: A relentless pressure campaign against Rep. Lauren Boebert has made her more suspicious and convinced of a conspiracy at play, according to a post by Annie Karni. This has fueled theories that Boebert is being targeted by a coordinated effort to undermine her political career.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 4:09 PM] Theory: The FBI has charged eleven individuals in a drug trafficking conspiracy in Pennsylvania. This has led to online discussions about the extent of drug trafficking networks and theories about potential connections to larger criminal organizations and even political figures.
  • [Nov 21, 2025, 9:01 PM] Theory: The FBI is highlighting its role in combating violent crime, leading to theories that this is a PR move to distract from other, more controversial activities. Some online forums suggest the FBI is selectively showcasing cases to improve its public image.
  • [Nov 20, 2025, 3:06 PM] Theory: The U.S. Marshals Service has updated its 'Memphis Safe Task Force' statistics, showing a large number of arrests and firearm seizures. This has prompted theories about the true scope of crime in Memphis and whether these numbers are being accurately reported to the public.
  • [Nov 24, 2025, 9:14 PM] Theory: The U.S. Marshals in Cedar Rapids have arrested an individual on charges of conspiracy to distribute a controlled substance. This has sparked local online discussions and theories about the extent of the drug trade in the area and the potential for more arrests.
